page.title: 08Agriculture in Dutton
page.content:
{Dutton}land is owned by Cheshire {County Council.}The largest farm has just 120 acres, but the average is only fifty acres. One farm of eighty acres is privately owned.
Most of the farms are{dairy,}but a small acreage is devoted to arable farming. Most of the crops grown are for cattle fodder - barley, oats and silage.
There are two farm shops and one for poultry and eggs.
One farm rears{turkeys.}The chicks are brought in at one day old, reared for between four and ten weeks. They are then dispatched to all parts of England, Wales and Scotland.
